page.title: 14THE CHILBRIDGE FARM
page.content: {NATURE WALKS We walked along quiet farm tracks with layed hedgerows filled with nettles and wild flowers{.}Young trees are cut in half downwards,pushed over and woven together.We saw pheasants,partridge,rabbits,wild birds and butterflies.We reached{Kingston {Coppe}where birch,beech,elm and other oak trees were wild. At{ Chilbridge}Farm cows grazed in fields on one side.1st on the other side grew barley and the other field is wheat.We saw fresian calves in the barn.Then{Mr.Richard's}and{Mr.Croft showed us the farm.We climbed a ladder to see the rotory milking parlour.We watched how sileage was made.The farm is unusual in that it also processes its own feedstock from its crops.Piglets screamed and squiggled.
